content:
• Wednesday, January 30, 2013
  • CNQR

    More on Concur Technologies (NASDAQ:CNQR): FQ1 beats on the top line as total sales jump by 22%...

    More on Concur Technologies (NASDAQ:CNQR): FQ1 beats on the top line as total sales jump by 22% Y/Y. Net losses widened however, as the hosted software maker reports increased operating expenses and other charges, masking higher revenue. The company also gives a downbeat FQ2 revenue outlook, now expecting an EPS of $0.24 with revenue expected to grow 19%. Analysts are projecting $0.21 on revenue growth of 22%. Shares -6.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 PM
  • SWKS

    More on Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ1 beats across the board on double-digit gains in...

    More on Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ1 beats across the board on double-digit gains in total revenue. Net earnings also rose by 16% Y/Y as the wireless-chip supplier cited broad-based demand for its chips among a diverse range of end markets including smartphones, home appliances and medical sensors. For the current quarter, the company expects to earn $0.47 on revenue of around $420M. The Street is looking for an EPS of $0.46 on revenue of $416M. Shares +1.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 PM
  • CLB

    Core Labs (NYSE:CLB): Q4 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $254.5M beats by $8.01M. Shares...

    Core Labs (NYSE:CLB): Q4 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $254.5M beats by $8.01M. Shares +1.7% AH. (PR)

  • CTXS

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Citrix (CTXS - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $670M-$680M and EPS of...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Citrix (CTXS - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $670M-$680M and EPS of $0.62-$0.63 vs. a consensus of $670.7M and $0.67. Expects 2013 revenue of $2.95B-$2.98B and EPS of $3.13-$3.15 vs. a consensus of $2.91B and $3.14. 2) ServiceNow (NOW - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $81.5M-$82.5M and EPS of -$0.05 to -$0.04 vs. a consensus of $78.1M and -$0.01. Expects 2013 revenue of $387M-$392M vs. consensus of $368.3M. 3) Electronic Arts (EA - earnings) expects FQ4 revenue of $1.025B-$1.125B and EPS of $0.57-$0.72, mostly below a consensus of $1.22B and $0.71. CTXS +11.6% AH. NOW +8%. EA -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • ALGN

    More on Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q4 beats on all counts on a rebound in demand for its...

    More on Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q4 beats on all counts on a rebound in demand for its Invisalign braces. Net profit fell 53% Y/Y however, burdened by heavy write-downs and other expenses, which masked overall revenue growth. For the current quarter, ALGN expects an EPS of $0.21 to $0.23 and revenue of $146M to $150.5M. Street estimates are for earnings of $0.26 cents on revenue of $145M. The company also says that CFO Kenneth Arola will step down as of March 4, and General counsel Roger George will serve as interim CFO while the company searches for a permanent replacement. Shares +8.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM): Q4 EPS of -$0.11 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $2.16B beats by...

    STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM): Q4 EPS of -$0.11 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $2.16B beats by $10M. Shares -8.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) guides on its Q4 call for Q1 revenue of $138M-$141M and 2013 revenue of...

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) guides on its Q4 call for Q1 revenue of $138M-$141M and 2013 revenue of $625M-$635M, mostly above a consensus of $139.6M and $618.9M. The company expects 2013 EPS of $0.60-$0.61, in-line with a $0.61 consensus. Shares +16.3% AH thanks to the guidance and a strong Q4 beat. Recent downgrades aren't looking too smart. Up in sympathy: PANW +3.1%. FIRE +4.9%. CHKP +1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • TSCO

    More on Tractor Supply (NASDAQ:TSCO): Q4 handily beats EPS consensus estimates as its bottom...

    More on Tractor Supply (NASDAQ:TSCO): Q4 handily beats EPS consensus estimates as its bottom line benefits from improved inventory management and a reduction in its exposure to weather trends. Net earnings climbed 13% Y/Y on continued sales growth, led by edible, usable and other consumable products. For the year, the company projects an EPS of $4.32 to $4.40 on revenue of $5.07B to $5.17B, in line with Street estimates. Shares +6.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • FTNT

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FTNT +16%. CTXS +11%. ALGN +10%. SWKS +9%. NOW +8%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FTNT +16%. CTXS +11%. ALGN +10%. SWKS +9%. NOW +8%.
    After-hours top losers: FIO -20%. FSL -13%. MANH -7%. CNQR -6%. RMD -5%.

  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (QCOM) discloses on its FQ1 call CFO William Keitel is retiring, effecting March 11....

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) discloses on its FQ1 call CFO William Keitel is retiring, effective March 11. He's being replaced by Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) CFO George Davis. AMAT says it's looking for a successor. QCOM +6.7% AH thanks to an FQ1 beat fueled by stronger-than-expected baseband chip and (royalty-bearing) 3G/4G device sales, and solid FQ2/FY13 guidance. In its slide deck (.pdf), Qualcomm notes 2012 device sales beat prior guidance in all regions except North America. Cash/equivalents stand at $28.4B ($18.3B offshore).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ1 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $453.7M (+15% Y/Y) beats by...

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ1 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $453.7M (+15% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Expects FQ2 revenue of $420M and EPS of $0.47, above consensus of $416.2M and $0.46. Shares +12.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • CACI

    More on CACI International (NYSE:CACI): Q4 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but...

    More on CACI International (NYSE:CACI): Q4 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but coming up short on revenue. Net income rose 7.4% Y/Y, boosted by a 3.4% rise in contract funding orders and a lack of charges that impacted its prior-year results. FY13 guidance brackets estimates for revenue and comes on the high side of EPS consensus. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is now only down 1.7% AH in response to its Q4 beat, which followed a 50%+...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is now only down 1.7% AH in response to its Q4 beat, which followed a 50%+ rally over the last 3 months. Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) is up 1.6% - the fact Facebook's Payments revenue rose 8% Q/Q (but was flat Y/Y) after adjusting for an accounting quirk is going over well. In its Q4 slide deck (.pdf), Facebook notes its global ARPU rose 19% Q/Q and 12% Y/Y to $1.54. ARPU for the U.S./Canada ($4.08) is still well above ARPUs for Europe ($1.71), Asia ($0.69), and the rest of the world ($0.56). U.S./Canada made up 49% of Q4 sales vs. 50% in Q3. CC is underway (webcast, live blog).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM | 2 Comments

    Golar LNG Partners (NASDAQ:GMLP) -4.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 3.9M common...

    Golar LNG Partners (NASDAQ:GMLP) -4.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 3.9M common units; Golar LNG Ltd. (NASDAQ:GLNG) will purchase $12.4M of units in a private placement to close concurrently with the public offering. GMLP plans to use net proceeds to fund part of its purchase of LNG carrier Golar Maria.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • LVS

    More on Las Vegas Sands' (NYSE:LVS) Q4: Margins were negatively impacted by a lower table game...

    More on Las Vegas Sands' (NYSE:LVS) Q4: Margins were negatively impacted by a lower table game hold and a $240M tax assessment at Marina Bay Sands. Revenue per available room fell 1.3% to $231. The company raises its quarterly dividend to $0.35 per share from a quarter. LVS +4.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • VNR

    Vanguard Natural Resources (NYSE:VNR) -4.9% AH after announcing a public offering of 8M common...

    Vanguard Natural Resources (NYSE:VNR) -4.9% AH after announcing a public offering of 8M common units. VNR intends to use net proceeds to pay down debt from its senior secured revolving credit facility, which was incurred in part to fund recent acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 21 Comments

    Citrix Systems (NASDAQ:CTXS): Q4 EPS of $0.9 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $740M (+19% Y/Y) beats by $34.27M. Shares +8.2% AH. (PR)

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO): FQ2 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $120.6M beats by $0.68M....

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA): FQ3 EPS of $0.57 in-line. Revenue of $1.18B misses by $0.11B....

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA): FQ3 EPS of $0.57 in-line. Revenue of $1.18B misses by $0.11B. Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)

  • AMD

    AMD (AMD -3.5%) slumps in afternoon trading thanks to a credit downgrade from Fitch: the...

    AMD (AMD -3.5%) slumps in afternoon trading thanks to a credit downgrade from Fitch: the chipmaker's long-term and senior unsecured debt have both been lowered to CCC (3 notches below investment-grade) from B. The ratings agency expects AMD to post negative free cash flow of $250M-$450M for 2013, and predicts annual sales will decline at a mid-to-high teens rate. It's also concerned about upcoming cash payments to Globalfoundries. Fitch had already downgraded AMD in October. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • MTOR

    Shares of Meritor (MTOR -12.8%) are among the day's worst performers as the producer of parts...

    Shares of Meritor (MTOR -12.8%) are among the day's worst performers as the producer of parts for commercial vehicles posted a surprise FQ1 loss and saw revenue drop slightly, while unveiling plans to cut 200 positions worldwide. MTOR also cut its full-year revenue estimates but backed its adjusted earnings guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • ADT

    Shares of ADT (ADT +3.5%) are set to finish higher despite a mixed FQ1 earnings report earlier...

    Shares of ADT (ADT +3.5%) are set to finish higher despite a mixed FQ1 earnings report earlier today. Net earnings rose 13% Y/Y as the security-services company increased its revenue from monitoring services and added more customers. Operating margin rose to 23% from 22.1%. The company also announced plans to buy back about $600M of its common stock from Credit Suisse International under an accelerated share-repurchase agreement.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • VELTF

    Mobile ad agency Velti (VELT -25%) has crashed over the last hour of trading. Remarks made...

    Mobile ad agency Velti (VELT -25%) has crashed over the last hour of trading. Remarks made during the company's analyst day are the apparent culprit.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 6 Comments
  • MET

    MetLife's (MET -1.3%) interest in purchasing Provida - Chile's largest pension fund...

    MetLife's (MET -1.3%) interest in purchasing Provida - Chile's largest pension fund administrator - may be sound, says Sterne, Agee, but it could be a signal to investors that the feds aren't about to green light additional capital returns. The reality is the insurer may not get that permission and has little choice but to pursue mergers with its excess capital.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • KBH

    KB Home (KBH +2.2%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperform at Credit Suisse today. The firm...

    KB Home (KBH +2.2%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperform at Credit Suisse today. The firm cites accelerating order growth and improving margins. It also raises its to $24 from $14.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • ENDP

    Endo Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:ENDP) resumes trading, now up over 12%.

    Endo Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:ENDP) resumes trading, now up over 12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • ENDP

    Shares of Endo Pharmaceutical (ENDP +6.7%) have been halted due to volatility after spiking 6%...

    Shares of Endo Pharmaceutical (ENDP +6.7%) have been halted due to volatility after spiking 6% higher in a matter of minutes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSX

    Phillips 66 (PSX +2.7%) is studying "any and all options" on whether to sell its two California...

    Phillips 66 (PSX +2.7%) is studying "any and all options" on whether to sell its two California refineries given challenges with state regulatory requirements and high costs, CEO Greg Garland tells analysts. In Q4, PSX increased its runs of advantaged crudes such as cheap inland U.S. crude and Canadian heavy oil to 67% of its overall U.S. crude slate, up from 57% Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • BTU

    On second thought, maybe Peabody's (BTU -5%) Q4 doesn't look so hot after all, as shares slump...

    On second thought, maybe Peabody's (BTU -5%) Q4 doesn't look so hot after all, as shares slump after yesterday's 5.6% gain and drag down other coal names: ANR -2.5%, ACI -3.4%, WLT -1.4%, CLD -2.7%. There's worry that U.S. revenues will be lower than expected and Australia costs will be higher. But Sterne Agee keeps its Buy rating, expecting Q1 will mark the low point for earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • TMO

    Life Technologies (LIFE +3.8%) gets a boost from takeover speculation after a report circulates...

    Life Technologies (LIFE +3.8%) gets a boost from takeover speculation after a report circulates claiming that Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO +0.5%) is considering an offer for the company. Numerous private equity firms including KKR (KKR +0.4%), Blackstone Group (BX -1.2%), Bain Capital and TPG Capital also appear to have expressed an interest as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • DELL

    After getting clocked yesterday thanks to downbeat guidance from the company itself and VMware,...

    After getting clocked yesterday thanks to downbeat guidance from the company itself and VMware, EMC (EMC +2.6%) is rebounding with the help of an upgrade to buy from Monness Crespi. The rally comes as EMC introduces a refresh for its Greenplum Data Computing Appliance, often used in big data projects. The update includes major performance gains, Isilon storage integration, and joint support for Greenplum's database and the Hadoop analytics framework. Also, EMC's RSA unit is rolling out new security analytics software.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZBH

    Zimmer Holdings (ZMH -1%) slips on a downgrade to Hold at Summer Street on valuation. The stock...

    Zimmer Holdings (ZMH -1%) slips on a downgrade to Hold at Summer Street on valuation. The stock has been on a tear since the beginning of the year, rising nearly 17% on optimism over FDA clearance to market iASSIST Knee for knee replacement procedures.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • HLIT

    Harmonic (HLIT -5.5%) dives after delivering mixed Q4 results and (more importantly) guiding for...

    Harmonic (HLIT -5.5%) dives after delivering mixed Q4 results and (more importantly) guiding for Q1 revenue of $115M-$125M, below a $133.3M consensus. On its earnings call, the provider of pay-TV infrastructure gear mentioned demand from U.S. satellite/telco and European customers is weak, while insisting it hasn't lost share with either group. Harmonic also claims it has "a few large projects" that won't be recognized until 2H. Down in sympathy: ENVI -6.7%. ARRS -1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • MERU

    Midday top 10 gainers: MERU +40%. CWBC +21%. BIOC +19%. MGAM +17%. FSL +17%. HTCH +17%. DLHC...

    Midday top 10 gainers: MERU +40%. CWBC +21%. BIOC +19%. MGAM +17%. FSL +17%. HTCH +17%. DLHC +17%. CPNO +14%. USAK +14%. IBCP +14%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: VTUS -21%. KTCC -18%. MTOR -16%. HA -13%. ATTU -12%. CODE -12%. CEVA -12%. AUDC -11%. TRMD-OLD -10%. UPI -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +1%) moves higher in today's trading on an upgrade to Buy at TheStreet,...

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +1%) moves higher in today's trading on an upgrade to Buy at TheStreet, citing the company's strong financials, "robust" revenue growth and a respectable return on equity.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI +3.9%) has struck a mobile payments partnership with Square: Angie's Business...

    Angie's List (ANGI +3.9%) has struck a mobile payments partnership with Square: Angie's Business Center app, used by the kinds of local merchants who have embraced Square's mobile card readers en masse, will now support Square-based payments.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • CEVA

    Ceva (CEVA -14.3%) tanks after providing light Q1 guidance - revenue of $12M-$13M and EPS of...

    Ceva (CEVA -14.3%) tanks after providing light Q1 guidance - revenue of $12M-$13M and EPS of $0.13-$0.15 vs. a consensus of $14M and $0.22 - to go with an in-line Q4. The DSP core/SoC licensing firm is suffering from declining sales of 2G phones that rely on baseband chips featuring Ceva's IP, as well as lower ASPs for those chips.Ceva, which has licensed its designs to Intel, Broadcom, Spreadtrum, and ST-Ericsson, is counting on 3G/4G smartphone sales to fuel a 2H royalty rebound.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto (RIO -0.5%) reportedly considers a temporary halt to construction work at its $6.2B...

    Rio Tinto (RIO -0.5%) reportedly considers a temporary halt to construction work at its $6.2B Oyu Tolgoi copper and gold project in Mongolia to protest the government's demands for a greater share of profit from the mine. Shares of Turquoise Hill Resources (TRQ -3.6%), power supplier to the mine and 51% owned by RIO, are slammed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 3 Comments
  • NAVB

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +3.2%) moves up today after pricing its 1.54M shares secondary...

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +3.2%) moves up today after pricing its 1.54M shares secondary offering at $3.10 per share, just a penny shy of yesterday's close. The gross proceeds of sale total approximately $4.8M, and the company plans to use the proceeds to fund it's ongoing operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • RNN

    Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (RNN +3.3%) moves up this morning after being initiated by analysts at...

    Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (RNN +3.3%) moves up this morning after being initiated by analysts at Maxim with a Buy and a price target of $1.50 a share. The company specializes in oncology and CNS therapeutics, and has recently expanded its intellectual property around isoquinolinamine, a class of potent anti-cancer compounds, which provide potent anti-tumor activities in several human cancer cell lines, such as breast, prostate, colon, ovary, kidney, pancreas, glioblastoma and melanoma.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake's (CHK +6.4%) Archie Dunham says "the company is not for sale," but getting McClendon...

    Chesapeake's (CHK +6.4%) Archie Dunham says "the company is not for sale," but getting McClendon out removes a big obstacle in the way of a hostile takeover. CHK would make a juicy target for Asian state-controlled oil firms, Bernstein's Neil Beveridge writes; E&Ps with shale acreage or deepwater discoveries but lacking capital to develop the assets are exactly what they're looking for, given their access to low cost financing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 6 Comments
  • SVRA

    Microcap biopharmaceutical researcher Adventrx Pharmaceuticals (ANX +11.2%) gets a pop today...

    Microcap biopharmaceutical researcher Adventrx Pharmaceuticals (ANX +11.2%) gets a pop today after announcing that it's initiated patient recruitment for its Phase 3 clinical study of ANX-188 in sickle cell disease. Santosh Vetticaden, the company's Chief Medical Officer, says the drug "has the potential to be the first FDA-approved product for sickle cell disease vaso-occlusive crisis in fifteen years."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • BB

    More on RIM (a.k.a. BlackBerry): The first BB10 phones have been unveiled, and they look much...

    More on RIM (a.k.a. BlackBerry): The first BB10 phones have been unveiled, and they look much like the ones depicted in leaked images (I, II). The touchscreen-only Z10 features a high-res 4.2" display (slightly bigger than the iPhone 5, but smaller than most top Android phones), while the Q10 (rumored to be called the X10) sports a physical keyboard and a BlackBerry Bold-like design. Spec details are light for now. Shares now -6.3%, investors are selling on the news. (live blog)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 10 Comments
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.2%) is finally doing something many pundits and marketing execs long...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.2%) is finally doing something many pundits and marketing execs long advised it to: changing the company's name to BlackBerry. Going forward, the company will trade under the symbol BBRY on the NASDAQ, and BB on the Toronto exchange. Thorsten Heins made the announcement at RIM's BB10 event, which is getting underway. (live blog)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 25 Comments
  • HAE

    Haemonetics (HAE -8.4%) slides after reporting a mixed FQ3, beating on the bottom line but...

    Haemonetics (HAE -8.4%) slides after reporting a mixed FQ3, beating on the bottom line but coming up short on top line revenue. Total sales increased by 19% Y/Y, with organic revenue growth of 11% in Asia and 2% in Europe. which were partially offset by declines of 1% in North America and 2% in Japan. The company reaffirms its outlook for FY13, expecting an EPS of $1.65 - $1.70 on revenues of $888M - $898M,  below the Street view for an EPS of $1.70 on revenues of $900M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • FSL

    Freescale (FSL +17.4%) roars higher after easily beating Q4 estimates and providing Q1 guidance...

    Freescale (FSL +17.4%) roars higher after easily beating Q4 estimates and providing Q1 guidance well above consensus. Sales of microcontrollers (strong uptake for ARM-based designs) and base station power amplifiers (lifted by China's 3G buildout) were healthy, offsetting weakness in network processor, analog/sensor, and automotive IC sales. The results appear a validation of new CEO Gregg Lowe's efforts to narrow Freescale's R&D focus and restructure. Pac Crest thinks margins could rise throughout 2013. (transcript)
